page.title: 11PRIORY PRIMARY SCHOOL,3.
page.content: {6.9.1964.}The number on roll had droppedto 116, only 4 classrooms were in use. {1.2.65.}Two new corporation Housing estates were being built and 29 new pupils had been admitted. {7.9.1965.}There were now 6 classes and 177 pupils. The recently admitted children were from 22 different schools. There is an intake of about 60 pupils per year. {6.9.1969.}There was a reorganisation of schools in Hull into a three tier system. This became Priory Primary School for 5-9 year old pupils. There were 320 pupils in eight classrooms. {1.7.1985.}The school has again shrunk to about 150 pupils aged 4-9. Most pupils transfer to Setting Dyke J.H. at 9. Hull schools are about to be reorganised again and this will become a 5-11 school once more.
